definition: lit. cries of complaint fill the roads (idiom); complaints rise all around/discontent is openly voiced
to blame/to complain
sound/voice/tone/noise/reputation/classifier for sounds
to carry/to convey/to load/to hold/to fill up/and/also/as well as/simultaneously
to record in writing/to carry (i.e. publish in a newspaper etc)/Taiwan pr. [zai4]/year

road/path/CL:條|条[tiao2],股[gu3]/principle/truth/morality/reason/skill/method/Dao (of Daoism)/to say/to speak/to talk/classifier for long thin things (rivers, cracks etc), barriers (walls, doors etc), questions (in an exam etc), commands, courses in a meal, steps in a process/(old) circuit (administrative division)

sentences.chinese: 渔民因此头昏目眩而怨声载道。

sentences.english: Internet chat rooms are packed with frustrated CFA candidates.
sentences.chinese: CFA考生在互联网聊天室里怨声载道。

sentences.english: Every other country complains about your bank-secrecy laws.
sentences.chinese: 《银行保密法》是众矢之的，其他国家全都怨声载道。

sentences.english: You can hear the hollering on the floor.
sentences.chinese: 你可以听到交易厅中怨声载道。

sentences.english: The citizens complained to heaven about the tax burden.
sentences.chinese: 公民对苛捐杂税怨声载道。

sentences.english: Local residents often complain about noise and crime associated with the bases.
sentences.chinese: 驻军噪音扰民甚至从事犯罪活动，当地居民怨声载道。

definition: wail/lament/voice of complaint
to whine on for days (idiom)/to endlessly grumble complaints/incessant whining
to suffer unspeakable misery/indescribably painful/hellish
The people have no way to make a living (idiom, from Record of the Grand Historian 史記|史记[Shi3 ji4])/no way of getting by
to complain without stopping (idiom); to bitch endlessly/incessant grievances
to tax by force and extort levies (idiom); to screw taxes out of the people by force
popular grievance/complaints of the people
angry, but not daring to speak out (idiom); obliged to remain silent about one's resentment/unable to voice objections
pinyin: gan3 nu4 er2 bu4 gan3 yan2

definition: lit. belly full of complaints (idiom)/discontent/always moaning and complaining
seething discontent (idiom); popular grievances boil over
(of a nation, government etc) demoralized/disunited
not to enjoy popular support/to be unpopular
billowing smoke (idiom)/foul atmosphere/(fig.) murky atmosphere/in a turmoil
unable to bear the pain (idiom)
to exploit/to practice usury
exorbitant taxation (idiom)
